summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms previous resolutions and Presidential statements on Abyei and the Sudan-South Sudan border, stressing full compliance and implementation.

Reaffirms commitment to Sudan and South Sudan's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Recognizes the current situation in Abyei and along the border as a threat to international peace and security.

Decides to extend UNISFA's mandate, as outlined in resolution 2575 (2021) paragraphs 1 and 2, until 15 December 2021, referencing resolutions 1990 (2011), 2024 (2011), 2075 (2012), and 2550 (2020).

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
